content.question: A certain factory that manufactures office chairs has a quality control process to identify defective chairs. The binomial random variable <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represents the number of chairs in a sample of chairs that are defective. The mean of <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is 10 chairs and the standard deviation is 3 chairs. Based on the distribution of <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, which of the following would be an accurate interpretation of the value 0.1 ?

choices.label: The total number of defective chairs made
The total number of non-defective chairs made
The relative frequency of the sample size to the population of chairs
The probability of identifying a non-defective chair
The probability of identifying a defective chair

content.answer: The probability of identifying a defective chair

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
